title: What is the transmission of the secret language of the "Fedeli di Amore" and its relation to traditional doctrine and the symbolism of love and knowledge in Dante's work?
first_phrase: This text explores the transmission of secret language and traditional doctrine among various esoteric groups, focusing specifically on the Fedeli di Amore movement. The author references the work of A. Reghini, Rossetti, and Valli to support the notion that the Fedeli di Amore's secret language was passed down through ancient traditions. In the final 200 tokens, the author continues to discuss the concept of Amore as the "Intelligenza attiva" and how it relates to the Fedeli's ideology, referencing Dante's "Commedia." The author also highlights the interpretation of the Fedeli's secret language as a means of identifying those who are "in error," specifically those within the Roman Catholic Church.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the study of the medieval sect language and the symbolism of love and memory lead to a deeper understanding of the human consciousness and the pursuit of truth.
